meanings.definition: A gene that has been artificially introduced into the genome of an organism.
meanings.sent1: Scientists inserted a transgene into the plant to make it resistant to pests.
meanings.sent2: The transgene from a fish was added to the tomato plant to improve its growth.
meanings.sent3: The transgene in the rabbit made it hop twice as high, much to the surprise of the researchers.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a transgene injected into the team, sparking new ideas and innovations.
meanings.sent5: The transgene acted like a superhero gene, saving the crop from destruction.

meanings.definition: The segment of DNA containing the gene that has been artificially introduced.
meanings.sent1: The transgene was carefully isolated and studied in the laboratory.
meanings.sent2: Researchers identified the transgene responsible for the unique trait in the modified plant.
meanings.sent3: The transgene seemed to have a mind of its own, dictating the plant's characteristics.
meanings.sent4: In her DNA, there was a hidden transgene waiting to be expressed, shaping her future.
meanings.sent5: The transgene was like a secret code embedded in the genetic blueprint of the organism.
